FuncDef:
The auto-defend alarm enable command enables the event reporting function for attack source tracing.
The undo auto-defend alarm enable command disables the event reporting function for attack source tracing. The auto-defend alarm enable command enables the event reporting function for attack source tracing. The undo auto-defend alarm enable command disables the event reporting function for attack source tracing. By default, the event reporting function for attack source tracing is disabled.
ExtraInfo: When the number of packets of a specified protocol from an attack source exceeds the threshold in a specified period, the device reports an event to the administrator so that the administrator can take measures to protect the device.
